private_information: You are robot_alpha. You can observe a subset of the blocks and report the observed initial configuration and the executed action sequence as you receive them.
You follow standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
robot_alpha.goal: Observe and report the parts of the initial configuration and action sequence assigned to you.

private_information: You are robot_beta. You can observe a subset of the blocks and report the observed initial configuration and the executed action sequence as you receive them.
You follow standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
robot_beta.goal: Observe and report the parts of the initial configuration and action sequence assigned to you.

private_information: You coordinate observations from robot_alpha and robot_beta and produce a consolidated planning problem reflecting the BlocksWorld initial state and listed actions.
Your output must be a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct if modeling multi-agent actions.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that encodes the BlocksWorld instance and the task of deriving the final arrangement after the given action sequence.

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld domain. Only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved are A B C D E F G H I J.
Initial arrangement: A is on C, B is on the table, C is on the table, D is on B, E is on I, F is on H, G is on D, H is on the table, I is on the table, J is on E.

Action sequence to execute in order: 1. unstack(F,H) 2. stack(F,A) 3. unstack(J,E) 4. stack(J,F) 5. unstack(E,I) 6. stack(E,I) 7. pickup(H) 8. stack(H,J) 9. unstack(G,D) 10. stack(G,E) 11. unstack(G,E) 12. putdown(G) 13. pickup(G) 14. stack(G,E) 15. unstack(G,E) 16. putdown(G) 17. pickup(G) 18. stack(G,H) 19. unstack(D,B) 20. putdown(D) 21. pickup(B) 22. putdown(B) 23. unstack(G,H) 24. putdown(G) 25. unstack(E,I) 26. stack(E,G) 27. pickup(I) 28. stack(I,E) 29. unstack(H,J) 30. stack(H,B).
Derived final arrangement after executing the actions: A is on C, B is on the table, C is on the table, D is on the table, E is on G, F is on A, G is on the table, H is on B, I is on E, J is on F.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_alpha. Provide a clear observation report of the subset of the initial BlocksWorld configuration and action steps assigned to you. Do not produce PDDL. Provide structured factual statements about block positions and observed actions.
observe.prompt: You are robot_alpha. Use your private information and the public information to emit an observation report describing the parts of the initial configuration and actions you observed. Keep the report factual and structured.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_beta. Provide a clear observation report of the subset of the initial BlocksWorld configuration and action steps assigned to you. Do not produce PDDL. Provide structured factual statements about block positions and observed actions.
observe.prompt: You are robot_beta. Use your private information and the public information to emit an observation report describing the parts of the initial configuration and actions you observed. Keep the report factual and structured.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing PDDL for FastDownwards. You will produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that model a BlocksWorld instance consistent with the supplied public information and the observation reports. The PDDL should be compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Consolidate the observation reports from the robots into a complete BlocksWorld initial state and encode the provided action sequence as the sequence of executed actions. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownwards solver that represent the BlocksWorld rules, the initial state, and the goal that validates the derived final arrangement. Keep agent actions distinct if modeling actions by different agents. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
